text: Agra is a city in Phillips County, Kansas, United States. In 2020, 208 people lived there. ==History== Agra was first settled in 1888. It was incorporated in 1904. Agra was a station on the Chicago, Rock Island and Pacific Railroad. It was named after Agra in India. ==Geography== Agra is at (39.761262, -99.119427). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . All of it is land. ==People== ===2020 census=== The 2020 census says that there were 208 people, 101 households, and 60 families living in Agra. Of the households, 83.2% owned their home and 16.8% rented their home. Children under age 18 lived in 13.9% of the households. The median age was 54.0. Of the people, 92.3% were White, 1.0% were Native American, 1.4% were some other race, and 5.3% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 6.3% of the people. ===2010 census=== The 2010 census says that there were 267 people, 116 households, and 78 families living in Agra. ==References== ==Other websites== ;City * Agra - Directory of Public Officials ;Schools * USD 110, local school district ;Maps * Agra City Map , KDOT Category:Cities in Phillips County, Kansas Category:1888 establishments in Kansas
title: Agra, Kansas
